user.title: Aquarium AI Setup
user.description: Set up AI-powered aquarium monitoring and analysis. This integration uses AI to analyze your aquarium sensors and provide intelligent recommendations through Home Assistant notifications.

data_description.tank_name: Enter a custom name for your aquarium (e.g., 'Main Tank', 'Reef Setup', 'Community Tank'). This name will appear in notifications and service calls.
data_description.aquarium_type: Specify your aquarium type to provide context for AI analysis. Common types include Freshwater, Marine, Brackish, or custom types like 'Cichlid Tank' or 'Reef Aquarium'.
data_description.temperature_sensor: Choose the temperature sensor entity that monitors your aquarium. Temperature sensors with proper device class are preferred.
data_description.ph_sensor: Select a sensor that measures pH levels in your aquarium. pH may not have units.
data_description.salinity_sensor: Choose a sensor that measures salinity or specific gravity in your aquarium.
data_description.dissolved_oxygen_sensor: Select a sensor that measures dissolved oxygen levels in your aquarium water.
data_description.water_level_sensor: Choose a sensor that measures water level. This can be numeric (e.g., 80%) or text (e.g., Normal/High/Low).
data_description.camera: Select a camera entity that provides a view of your aquarium. The AI will analyze the image for water clarity, fish health, plant condition, and general aquarium maintenance needs. Visual analysis complements sensor data for comprehensive monitoring.
data_description.update_frequency: Select how often the AI should analyze your aquarium sensors and send notifications. Choose based on your monitoring needs - more frequent for sensitive setups, less frequent for stable systems.
data_description.ai_task: Select an AI task entity from your Home Assistant configuration (e.g., ai_task.google_ai_task or ai_task.openai_ai_task).
data_description.auto_notifications: When enabled, notifications are sent automatically at the configured frequency. When disabled, notifications are only sent when triggered manually using the service.
data_description.notification_format: Choose the level of detail for notification messages. Full format provides comprehensive parameter analysis, condensed format shows brief analysis, and minimal format displays only parameter values with overall assessment.

error.sensor_not_found: Selected sensor was not found. Please select a valid sensor.
error.sensor_required: Please select a temperature sensor to monitor your aquarium.
error.invalid_sensor: The selected sensor is not a valid sensor.
error.no_sensors: No sensors found. Please ensure you have sensors set up in Home Assistant before configuring this integration.
error.at_least_one_sensor: At least one sensor must be configured. Please select at least one sensor to monitor.
error.ai_task_required: Please select an AI task entity to use for analysis.

init.title: Aquarium AI Options
init.description: Modify your aquarium monitoring settings. Changes will take effect immediately without restarting Home Assistant.

data_description.tank_name: Update the name for your aquarium. This name appears in all notifications and can help identify multiple tank setups.
data_description.aquarium_type: Change your aquarium type to improve AI analysis accuracy. The AI provides different recommendations based on aquarium type (e.g., Marine tanks need different parameter ranges than Freshwater).
data_description.temperature_sensor: Switch to a different temperature sensor if you've added new sensors or want to monitor a different location in your aquarium.
data_description.ph_sensor: Update or change the pH sensor for your aquarium monitoring.
data_description.salinity_sensor: Update or change the salinity sensor for your aquarium monitoring.
data_description.dissolved_oxygen_sensor: Update or change the dissolved oxygen sensor for your aquarium monitoring.
data_description.water_level_sensor: Update or change the water level sensor for your aquarium monitoring.
data_description.camera: Update or change the camera for visual aquarium monitoring. The AI will analyze camera images for water quality, fish health, and maintenance needs.
data_description.update_frequency: Adjust notification frequency based on your needs. Use shorter intervals during critical periods (water changes, new fish) or longer intervals for stable, established tanks.
data_description.ai_task: Change which AI task entity to use for analysis. Select from available AI task entities in your Home Assistant setup.
data_description.auto_notifications: Toggle automatic notifications on/off. When disabled, notifications are only sent when manually triggered via the service.
data_description.notification_format: Choose how detailed the notification messages should be. Full format includes comprehensive analysis, condensed shows brief analysis, minimal shows only parameters and overall assessment.

error.at_least_one_sensor: At least one sensor must be configured. Please select at least one sensor to monitor.
error.ai_task_required: Please select an AI task entity to use for analysis.

run_analysis.name: Run AI Analysis
run_analysis.description: Manually trigger an immediate AI analysis for all configured aquarium integrations. This is useful for on-demand analysis after water changes, equipment adjustments, or when creating automations.
